headline.main: TO MAKE A CLEAN JOB OF IT

lead_paragraph: Commenting on Mr. Willkie's proposal for a clear-cut and complete repeal of the Neutrality Act, the chairman of the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations expresses the opinion that there are certain provisions of that legislation which ought to be preserved. He mentions, among other things, that part of the law which establishes a Munitions Control Board to license the export of war materials.
abstract: eds on Willkie and Cudahy proposals
